content: In Greek mythology, who is known as the God of the Sea and is often depicted holding a trident?

In Greek mythology, Poseidon is known as the god of the sea. He is often depicted holding a trident, which he uses to create earthquakes and control the oceans. Poseidon is one of the twelve Olympian gods and is brothers with Zeus and Hades. His domains include the sea, earthquakes, and horses.
